intro: Climacoptera turcomanica, commonly known as the Turkmenian climacoptera, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping to conserve water. The flowers are often yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
